title: Havin' MASSIVE framerate drops since patch 6.18
body:
Usually I have 30-60 FPS when I play league, but lately i've been consistently getting FPS drops as low as 5-10, and it gets worse the later on a game goes. My ping is typically 67-80 as worst but now it's mysteriously spiking between 120-200 ping, and i'm makin' sure there's nothin' running in the background that could lag the game out, and I know nothin' is downloadin' to slow my ping. I j'es don't understand what is happenin' and it's so annoying. I want to play league, but these FPS drops are drivin' me BONKERS!

Up until 6.18 my game usually runs pretty smoothly.

replies.body:
Unstable FPS issues are usually caused by a malfunctioning driver or power settings that prevent your video card from performing at its peak power output. As a first step, I recommend working through the [FPS troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) we've written up that *Rineyy* mentioned.

Let me know if those steps caused any change in your FPS.

What's interestin' is that for some reason, when I first start up league of legends and go into a CUSTOMS game without any other players, my ping is totally fine. My fps has slightly improved but my ping still hovers around 150-200 consistently in normal games. Usually if I have any ping increase it occurs even when i'm alone in a customs game.
lmao it's because you're the host : P

I'm glad to hear your FPS has gotten better after those steps. Your latency (ping) issue is definitely caused by different factors and is most likely a result of network settings that don't play well with League. Our [connection troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) is a great consolidated list of steps that could resolve your inconsistent latency.
